title: Balance out the boot enchants
body:
Homeguards are just too useful. There aren't many times when you shouldn't get them. The other boot enchants are interesting but rarely worth getting. This is a shame.

Make Homeguard just a default part of the fountain. You shouldn't need to buy it. This would make the game more fun and make room for the other enchants. It would probably need to be disabled after using teleport, but Distortion would take its place for teleport users.

As for the other enchants, here are some ideas to spice them up.

Distortion: Triggers after any dash or blink.

Furor: Triggers on all spell hits rather than just single target.

Alacrity: Add 5% tenacity and 5% slow resist (stacks with other sources of both effects)

Captain's: You get the bonus speed while moving towards enemies. Allies still only get it while moving towards you.

That's the problem. Homeguards are pretty much a guaranteed pick every game because of how useful they are and how (almost always) useless the other are in comparison. Riot, where's your strategic diversity there?

Nope. Most games, people end without boot enchants. I see Homeguards a lot from teams that are doing poorly and are pushed up to base; they're the "recovery" option for a bad mid-game and some decisive pushes.

I think in lower ELOs, I tend to get Homeguard because my team tends to more likely just be all over the map, and so I'm much more likely to suddenly need to be THERE not HERE without any good way to see that they all decided to farm that wave.

It sounds elo specific to me. I am only SIlver right now, and highest I have reached is Gold, so I can't say Homeguard is omni-present at higher elo's. I tend to go for Alacrity or Captain depending on role or situation, and typically only Homeguard when my team is losing or we have lost/will lose an inhib turret or two if we can't reach them fast. That said, i always feel a bit noobish with Alacrity, since the buff from base means that even with my burst in movement speed, I reach the fight much later, and the buff is so small compared to flat ms buffs, that it's usually just to keep up, and doesn't provide an edge in most scenarios. I see homeguard as a "defence" enchantment, but it's often used aggressively too, at least at my elo. Auto Homeguard shouldn't be level based, but time (after 30 minutes perhaps) and that's IF it is introduced, but for a while people have been saying that the other enchantments are underwhelming. I think the most useful is Captain, but only for 1 maybe two champs.

If you think about Distortion, doesn't the time saved from TP use, seem less than the time saved from Homeguard??? Homeguard is immediately and always useful for getting back to lane, to objectives or teamfights, distortion is a little helpful every 5 or so minutes or whatever the CDR for it is. The other items are not bad, just so niche that 9/10 homeguard is better, that's just how it feels for me anyway

The difference is the *impact* of the enchant on those who get strong benefits from building the item.

While Alacrity, Furor and Distortion definitely aren't without use, they're significantly less impactful.

-------

Distortion tends to be used to give champions who need their flash more often for fighting.  It's rarely bought for any other reason.

Furor often times has zero impact, as it's a kite/chase enchant, and the times it does do something you don't notice it.

Alacrity is the general pair, and again it's hard to notice the difference in most fights until you're chasing or fleeing on if the upgrade was beneficial.  

-----

TLDR:  Homeguard *Feels* rewarding because it's immediately noticeable with abuse case scenarios.

I like to pick up {{item:3284}} more often than {{item:3280}} . Once you leave the fountain and get to a lane, homeguards do literally absolutely nothing. Alacrity is always useful no matter where you are or what you're doing, and it's saved my life (and secured kills) more times than I can count.

>Once you leave the fountain and get to a lane, homeguards do literally absolutely nothing.

Good thing they provide massive utility long before you ever get back to lane.

I pick alacrity or furor all the time. I either want to kite or dodge. All the time. Homeguards, helpful, yes. But if you prevent the need to sprint because you are dominating.... then again I'm bronze 4.

I love you.

I honestly have no idea why Homeguard has such a higher pick rate than Alacrity when all Homeguard does is get you out of base about 5-8 seconds earlier. Alacrity helps you chase better in fights, run away better in fights, and actually provides you SOME amount of bonus stats in combat where Homeguard wouldn't. The point of Homeguard is to guard your home, namely run quickly at someone inside or near your base without having to wait the precious seconds you'd otherwise need as you are already in a vulnerable/losing situation.

The real question here is why Furor and even worse Distortion have such low pick rates. The only times someone would be better off thinking about distortion is if they were a top laner running Flash/Teleport(or if you're one of the few champs that prefer ghost), but even then it's a low priority late-game purchase. Furor, well, I'm short on time so I'll just say that it's also pretty situational when compared to Alacrity and Homeguard.

Alacrity is my default enchant.  Unless there's a specific reason for the champ I'm playing to use something else, I go with Alacrity.  I always build it on Hecarim for extra damage.  I build Furor on high AS characters (namely ADCs, Warwick, Vi and Kayle).  I've tried distortion a few times, but for top laners, I usually prefer Alacrity.  I'm considering using it on Skarner though, for flash + ults.  I only get homeguard if I'm well, defending the base and we're being pushed back hard.  In most of those types of games, however, I'm so starved for cash anyways that I don't get chance to enchant my boots.

I agree that enchantments need some balanceing, but not nearly as much as you propose.

Homeguard is ok, wouldn't mind the integration into fountain though

Alacrity is already a good enchant

Furor needs a stronger speedbuff, so either no decay or a high initial speed, otherwise it's not different enough from aclarity which currently gives a nearly as high speedbuff permanent.

Distortion is a really powerfull enchant, no need for buffs, especially not one that promotes already mobile champs even more.

Captain really could use some help and i finally agree with you on the ms-boost if running towards enemies.

i definitely enjoy your idea. lets say, grant 50% of the homeguard effect at level 7 and the full effect at level 13, but it ends upon using an an ability, spell or auto attack. (so you cant homeguard TP anymore, which is bullshit anyways)

also, my critique to your other suggestions:

distortion: no, please dont buff  mobility-creep champions even more. 
my suggestion: remove the summonerspell-specific buff and give it a flat summonerspell-CDR and a bonus effect for ALL summoner spells, not just mobility. that would take some time but its a cool idea. you want your barrier to shield nearby allies for 20%? you want your ignite to heal you for 20% of the damage dealt by it? you want your heal to affect 1 additional ally? you want your flash to dodge all auto attacks for 1 second after flashing so that pesky nasus-Q doesnt kill you mid air? those are just random ideas, but i would enjoy distortion to buff all summoners instead of just mobility.

furor: probably too good for kiting with skillshots. but well, whatever. lets try it.

alacrity: nah. its about movementspeed. how about the movespeed with alacrity increases from what it is now to 50 over 3 seconds if you keep running. its a nice buff for out-of-combat mobility but not as strong as mobility boots. probably too good anyways.

captains: very nice idea. also give it some visual thing like elixir of iron so the noobs actually KNOW they should follow you cuz CAPTAIN!

Funny thing is that Nasus's Q ignores dodge.

I feel that if distortion is left as is, it would be just fine.  Maybe buff its effects slightly, but it still does its job well.
The other change ideas are pretty cool though.

Also, your suggestions for distortion and furor are bad. Distortion would make champs like {{champion:7}}  and {{champion:76}}  completely uncatchable if they got MS after every dash. The furor is bad because it'll make champions with dots impossible to escape, since they will have continuous spell hits on you. Add in the fact that most dot chaps get the {{item:3116}}  {{item:3151}}  combo, and you will just die if they are ahead with no way to escape.
Getting Captain as a backlines support has benefits too, helps for when a fight goes south and everyone needs to retreat.
Captain's idea are very good that help a lot to make a better engage,

I think homeguard is more noticeable, but that doesn't necessarily make it stronger.  All the others are hidden power.  When homeguards makes a difference eveyrone knows it.  When furor makes a difference even the person who has it probably doesn't know that furor was the reason he was able to chase/kite successfully.

I kind of agree on homeguard TP being BS/OP, though.  With a good TP placement it isn't that necessary anyway (and if you don't have a good place to TP to, you don't deserve to make a big TP play).  Hec for example has a strong MS steroid of his own plus his ult; it's really just giving him a ton of free unbalanced damage through his passive.

I think they are all good however homeguard is just better overall.Therefore a price increase on it or price decrease on the others would probably solve the issue if it's an issue at all.
